data.title: 147 Geography Trivia Questions That Might Stump You
data.text:
Around The World In 147 Geography Trivia Questions (and Answers)

*Opens Google Maps.*

These geography questions and answers cover everything from landmarks to national monuments and span the entire globe. What can you do with this list? LOTS OF THINGS.

You can use it to take the quiz as a group, taking turns to ask the questions. You can also take the quiz alone if you hide each answer as you scroll down the list. You can even just read through the list to soak up geography facts. You never know when you'll need them!

There are a lot of easy questions here, but don't get cocky. The difficult ones may very well stump you if you haven't been in school for a while. Enjoy!

1. What country is known as "Land of a Thousand Lakes"?

2. What is the highest mountain in Africa?

Mount Kilimanjaro

3. Which sea is the world's smallest and shallowest sea?

Sea of Azov

4. In which mountain range would you find the K2, the second-highest peak in the world?

Karakoram Range

5. What ocean is on the West Coast of The United States?

6. Which Asian country is known as the "Land of the Thunder Dragon"?

Bhutan

7. What is the southernmost point of Africa called?

Cape Agulhas

8. In which country would you find the world's largest salt flat, Salar de Uyuni?

Bolivia

9. In which state can you find the Grand Canyon?

10. Which strait separates Saudi Arabia from Africa?

Bab el Mandeb

11. What is the second-largest island in the world and is part of Indonesia?

New Guinea

12. What is the northernmost national capital city in the world?

Reykjavik, Iceland

13. How many people live in New Zealand?

14. What is the capital city of Suriname?

Paramaribo

15. What is the smallest continent by area?

Australia.

16. The Great Lakes are made up of how many bodies of water?

5.

17. What is the highest point on Earth?

18. What United States city is known as "The City of Angels?"

Los Angeles.

19. What United States city is known as "The City of Fountains?"

Kansas City.

20. What is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea?

Sicily

21. What is a flat, elevated landform that rises sharply above adjacent land on at least one side?

22. What is the capital of Afghanistan?

Kabul

23. In which country would you find the Kalahari Desert?

Botswana

24. Which river forms part of the border between the United States and Mexico?

Rio Grande

25. Where is Guyana?

26. Which African country is the most populated?

Nigeria

27. What is the only country in the world that is also a continent?

Australia

28. Which African country is famous for being home to the Great Pyramid of Giza and the Sphinx?

Egypt

29. Where is Malta?

30. Which country is known as the Land of Fire and Ice due to its volcanoes and glaciers?

Iceland

31. What ocean is the largest and deepest?

The Pacific Ocean

32. What is the largest desert in the world?

Sahara desert

33. What country is this a photo of?

34. Which European country is known for its fjords and is the homeland of the Vikings?

Norway

35. Which mountain range runs along the western coast of South America?

Andes mountains

36. What is the capital city of The United States?

Washington, D.C.

37. What is this site called?

38. In which country would you find the Great Barrier Reef?

Australia

39. Which river is often called the "Father of Waters" and is the longest river in North America?

Mississippi River

40. What is the largest continent by land area?

Asia

41. What kind of map uses contour lines to connect points of equal elevation?

42. Which country is made up of 7,000 islands?

The Philippines

43. What is the most populous city in the world?

Tokyo, Japan

44. Which country has the most pyramids?

Sudan

45. Where is Moldova?

46. Where is the world's largest underground lake?

Namibia

47. In which ocean is the Bermuda Triangle located?

Atlantic Ocean

48. How many countries does Africa have?

54

49. Where are the Cliffs of Moher?

50. What is the smallest country in the world?

Vatican City

51. What is the capital of Senegal?

Dakar

52. Which ocean is between North America and Africa?

Atlantic

53. Where is Chile?

54. Which river flows from Minneapolis to Memphis to New Orleans?

Mississippi

55. How many countries are in North America?

23

(Besides Canada, the United States, and Mexico, North America also includes all the sovereign states in the Caribbean and Central America.)

56. What country lies roughly 90 miles southeast of Florida?

Cuba

57. Where is Mongolia?

58. What's the correct postal abbreviation for Mississippi?

MS

59. What mountain range is along the east side of the United States?

Appalachian

60. What's the capital of Tennessee?

Nashville

61. What country is this monument located in: Switzerland, Norway, or Spain?

62. What's the capital of Spain?

Madrid

63. What state sits between California and Washington?

Oregon

64. Which Northeastern state was not one of the 13 original colonies?

Maine

65. What's the capital of Greece: Athens, Larissa, or Patras?

66. Which city has the second largest population?

Delhi

(Delhi is the world's second most highly populated city, beaten only by Tokyo.)

67. What's the capital of New Hampshire?

Concord

68. The prime meridian is the line at 0º longitude or 0º latitude?

0º longitude

69. Where can you find the city of Valletta?

70. What's the capital of the United Kingdom?

London

71. What's the capital of Pennsylvania?

Harrisburg

72. What's the capital of Canada?

Ottawa

73. What is the name of this famous clock tower: Big Ben, Tom Tower, or Trafalgar Tower?

74. Which lake is not one of the Great Lakes: Superior, Huron, or Champlain?

Champlain

75. What's the capital of Italy?

Rome

76. Which North American city has a bigger population: Los Angeles or Mexico City?

Mexico City

77. What country is Lake Moraine in: Canada, Finland, or Iceland?

78. What measures distance north or south of the equator?

Latitude

79. What's the capital of France:?

Paris

80. What's the capital of Ireland?

Dublin

81. Where can you find these marvelous fields: Bangladesh, Austria, or Vietnam?

82. Which is the world's smallest ocean?

The Arctic

83. Where is Indonesia?

Asia

84. What's the capital of Germany?

Berlin

85. Where can you visit this cathedral: Russia, Germany, or Spain?

86. What's the capital of Russia?

Moscow

87. What's the capital of Romania?

Bucharest

88. What is this structure called: Burj Khalifa, Taj Mahal, or Humayun's Tomb?

89. What's the capital of Portugal?

Lisbon

90. Which of these countries has the smallest population: France, United Kingdom, or Spain?

Spain

(Spain has a population of 46.6 million people, compared with France, with 66.99 million, and the United Kingdom, with 68.7 million.)

91. What country should you visit to see this: Morocco, Bangladesh, or United Arab Emirates?

92. What's the capital of Sweden?

Stockholm

93. What's the capital of Belgium?

Brussels

94. What's the capital of Poland?

Warsaw

95. Where is Chad?

96. What's the capital of the Netherlands?

Amsterdam

97. Which Canadian province is the smallest?

Prince Edward Island

98. Where are the Maldives?

Asia

99. Where is Mexico: North America, Europe, or South America?

100. What's the capital of Denmark?

Copenhagen

101. What's the capital of Lithuania?

Vilnius

102. What's the capital of Hungary?

Budapest

103. What is this: the Parthenon, Taj Mahal, or Colosseum?

104. What is the longest river in the world?

Nile River

105. What's the capital of Switzerland?

Bern

106. What's the capital of Iceland?

Reykjavík

107. Where can you find the Capillas de Mármol: Chile, Greece, or Thailand?

108. Which city is the capital of Australia?

Canberra

109. Where is Croatia: South America, Africa, or Europe?

110. Australia is surrounded by all of the following bodies of water EXCEPT: the Timor Sea, Indian Ocean, or Philippine Sea?

Philippine Sea

111. What country is this an image of: France, the Netherlands, or Portugal?

112. What's the capital of Slovakia?

Bratislava

113. What are these called: Alexandrian Pyramids, Tomb of Tutankhamun, or Pyramids of Giza?

114. What is the currency in India?

Rupee

115. Where are these towers located: Malaysia, Singapore, or South Africa?

116. What's the capital of Albania?

Tirana

117. The Hoover Dam was built over which river: the Mississippi River, Colorado River, or Phoenix River?

118. What's the capital of Paraguay?

Asunción

119. Where is this located: Japan, Myanmar, or Belize?

120. What's the capital of Norway?

Oslo

121. Where can you go to see this castle: Scotland, Romania, or Tanzania?

122. What's the capital of Ukraine?

Kyiv

123. What's the capital of Colombia?

Bogotá

124. What's the capital of Czechia?

Prague

125. What country is this monument located in: Switzerland, Norway, or Albania?

126. What's the capital of Luxembourg?

Luxembourg City

127. What's the capital of Belarus?

Minsk

128. What's the capital of Montenegro?

Podgorica

129. What is this landmark called: the Great Barricade, Great Wall of China, or Retaining Wall?

130. Where is Nepal?

Asia

131. Where can you find this bridge: the United States, Germany, or the Netherlands?

132. What's the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina?

Sarajevo

133. Where are these pools located: Iceland, Denmark, or Turkey?

134. What's the capital of Austria?

Vienna

135. What's the capital of Estonia?

Tallinn

136. What's the capital of Serbia?

Belgrade

137. Where is Eritrea: Africa, Asia, Europe?

138. What's the capital of Japan?

Tokyo

139. What's the capital of Latvia?

Riga

140. What's the capital of Turkey?

Ankara

141. What is this famous landmark called: the Eiffel Tower, Tower of London, or Paris Spire?

142. What's the capital of Slovenia?

Ljubljana

143. What's the capital of Bulgaria?

Sofia

144. What's the capital of Finland?

Helsinki

145. What is this famous temple called: Angkor Wat, Hagia Sophia, or Petra?

146. What's the capital of North Macedonia?

Skopje

147. What's the name of this famous bridge in San Francisco: the Rouge Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge, or Golden Gate Bridge?

Share This Article
